segments.en: Linked Discourses 3
2. Childless
12. Five Kings
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pañcannaṃ rājūnaṃ pasenadipamukhānaṃ pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitānaṃ samaṅgībhūtānaṃ paricārayamānānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
segments.en: Now at that time five kings headed by Pasenadi were amusing themselves, supplied and provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation, and this discussion came up among them:
“What’s the best of sensual pleasures?”
Some of them said,
“Sights are the best of sensual pleasures!”
Others said,
“Sounds are best!”
Others said,
“Smells are best!”
Others said,
“Tastes are best!”
Others said,
“Touches are best!”

segments.pli: Yato kho te rājāno nāsakkhiṃsu aññamaññaṃ saññāpetuṃ.
segments.en: Since those kings were unable to convince each other,

segments.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo te rājāno etadavoca:
segments.en: King Pasenadi said to them,

segments.pli: “āyāma, mārisā, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamissāma; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etamatthaṃ paṭipucchissāma.
segments.en: “Come, good sirs, let’s go to the Buddha and ask him about this.

segments.pli: Yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā”ti.
segments.en: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, mārisā”ti kho te rājāno rañño pasenadissa kosalassa paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Yes, dear sir,” replied those kings.

segments.pli: Atha kho te pañca rājāno pasenadipamukhā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then those five kings headed by Pasenadi went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. King Pasenadi reported their conversation to the Buddha, and said,

segments.pli: “idha, bhante, amhākaṃ pañcannaṃ rājūnaṃ pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitānaṃ samaṅgībhūtānaṃ paricārayamānānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
Kiṃ nu kho, bhante, kāmānaṃ aggan”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, what’s the best of sensual pleasures?”

segments.pli: “Manāpapariyantaṃ khvāhaṃ, mahārāja, pañcasu kāmaguṇesu agganti vadāmi.
segments.en: “Great king, which kind of sensual stimulation is best is defined by which is most agreeable, I say.

segments.pli: Teva, mahārāja, rūpā ekaccassa manāpā honti, teva rūpā ekaccassa amanāpā honti.
segments.en: The very same sights that are agreeable to some are disagreeable to others.

segments.pli: Yehi ca yo rūpehi attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo, so tehi rūpehi aññaṃ rūpaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
segments.en: When you’re happy with certain sights, as you’ve got all you wished for, you don’t want any other sight that’s better or finer.
For you, those sights are perfect
and supreme.

segments.pli: Teva, mahārāja, saddā ekaccassa manāpā honti, teva saddā ekaccassa amanāpā honti.
segments.en: The very same sounds …

segments.pli: Yehi ca yo saddehi attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo, so tehi saddehi aññaṃ saddaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
Teva, mahārāja, gandhā ekaccassa manāpā honti, teva gandhā ekaccassa amanāpā honti.
segments.en: smells …

segments.pli: Yehi ca yo gandhehi attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo, so tehi gandhehi aññaṃ gandhaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
Teva, mahārāja, rasā ekaccassa manāpā honti, teva rasā ekaccassa amanāpā honti.
segments.en: tastes …

segments.pli: Yehi ca yo rasehi attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo, so tehi rasehi aññaṃ rasaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
Teva, mahārāja, phoṭṭhabbā ekaccassa manāpā honti, teva phoṭṭhabbā ekaccassa amanāpā honti.
segments.en: touches that are agreeable to some are disagreeable to others.

segments.pli: Yehi ca yo phoṭṭhabbehi attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo, so tehi phoṭṭhabbehi aññaṃ phoṭṭhabbaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
segments.en: When you’re happy with certain touches, as you’ve got all you wished for, you don’t want any other touch that’s better or finer.
For you, those touches are perfect
and supreme.”

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena candanaṅgaliko upāsako tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti.
segments.en: Now at that time the lay follower Candanaṅgalika was sitting in that assembly.

segments.pli: Atha kho candanaṅgaliko upāsako uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then he got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said,
“I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
“Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.

segments.pli: Atha kho candanaṅgaliko upāsako bhagavato sammukhā tadanurūpāya gāthāya abhitthavi:
segments.en: Then the lay follower Candanaṅgalika extolled the Buddha in his presence with an appropriate verse:
“Like a fragrant pink lotus
that blooms in the morning, its fragrance unfaded—
see Aṅgīrasa shine,
bright as the sun in the sky!”

segments.pli: Atha kho te pañca rājāno candanaṅgalikaṃ upāsakaṃ pañcahi uttarāsaṅgehi acchādesuṃ.
segments.en: Then those five kings clothed Candanaṅgalika with five upper robes.

segments.pli: Atha kho candanaṅgaliko upāsako tehi pañcahi uttarāsaṅgehi bhagavantaṃ acchādesīti.
segments.en: And Candanaṅgalika in turn endowed the Buddha with these robes.

suttaplex.blurb: Five kings including Pasenadi are enjoying themselves and wonder which of the senses affords the highest pleasure. They ask the Buddha, who replies that it is subjective, depending on a persons preferences. Inspired, the laymen Candanaṅgalika offers a verse in praise of the Buddha.
